alert.note: Alert for Beaufort; Northern Craven; Pamlico; Southern Craven (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 11 at 12:50PM EDT by NWS Newport/Morehead City
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Craven, southeastern Beaufort and northwestern Pamlico Counties through 130 PM EDT... At 1250 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Cayton, or 11 miles northeast of James City, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Ransomville, Pamlico Beach, Cayton, Lowland, Edward, Grantsboro, Royal, Bonnerton, Winsteadville, Core Point, South Creek, Bayview, Sidney Crossroads, Yeatesville, Aurora Ferry Terminal, Bayview Ferry Terminal, Aurora and Sydney Crossroads. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Beaufort; Northern Craven; Pamlico; Southern Craven
